sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
What is the determinant of the following matrix?
$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 7 & 2 \\
-1 & 5 & 3 \\
2 & 0 & 6
\end{bmatrix}
$$
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, we can use the following formula:

$$
\det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)
$$

where a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, and i are the elements of the matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
a & b & c \\
d & e & f \\
g & h & i
\end{bmatrix}
$$

In this case, the matrix is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
3 & 7 & 2 \\
-1 & 5 & 3 \\
2 & 0 & 6
\end{bmatrix}
$$

So, we have:

$$
\det(A) = 3(5 \cdot 6 - 3 \cdot 0) - 7(-1 \cdot 6 - 3 \cdot 2) + 2(-1 \cdot 0 - 5 \cdot 2)
$$

$$
\det(A) = 3(30 - 0) - 7(-6 - 6) + 2(0 - 10)
$$

$$
\det(A) = 3(30) + 7(12) - 20
$$

$$
\det(A) = 90 + 84 - 20
$$

$$
\det(A) = 154
$$

So, the determinant of the given matrix is 154.
